# create counters
cnt = collections.Counter(['a', 'b', 'c', 'a', 'b', 'b'])
cnt =  collections.Counter({'a':2, 'b':3, 'c':1})
cnt =  collections.Counter(a=2, b=3, c=1)

print(cnt) # Counter({'b': 3, 'a': 2, 'c': 1})

# add values
cnt.update(a=20)  # a becomes 2 + 20 =22

# most frequent
cnt.most_common(2)  # it gives list

# arithmetics and logical operations
c1 + c2 # Combined counts  #  c1.add(c2)
c1 - c2 # subtraction  # c1.subtract(c2)
c1 & c2 # intersections
c1 | c2 # union

# common works
sum(c.values())            # total of all counts
c.clear()                       # reset all counts
list(c)                           # list unique elements
set(c)                           # convert to a set
dict(c)                          # convert to a regular dictionary
c.items()                      # convert to a list of (elem, cnt) pairs
